artist: Illustrations by Russell Maret; Typography by Russell Maret; Text by Euclid; Translated by Sir Thomas Little Heath; Commentary by Russell Maret; Typeface designed by Russell Maret; Daniel Kelm; Published by Russell Maret
creditline: The Mary and Robyn Campbell Fund for Art Books
description: accordion-folded book, printed on both sides of pages; cover is dark grey paper with light blue leather geometric form and white horizontal line; illustrated with primarily geometric designs, maps and numbers in bright colors; Euclidean propositions and author's text narrative alternate; clamshell storage box covered with black and white woven cloth
marks: Signature and Edition on last page, in pencil: [Russell Maret]
medium: Color letterpress polymer prints, photo-polymer letterpress; bound accordian-style book
title: Interstices & Intersections or, An Autodidact Comprehends a Cube. Thirteen Euclidean Propositions.
